message.content:
cs.DL, cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.IR, cs.CYBER. 

The paper focuses on tracking the international movements of researchers through changes in their main affiliation addresses in the Web of Science database, which suggests a strong emphasis on digital libraries (cs.DL) and information retrieval (cs.IR). The study also examines the relative frequency of disciplines and countries of origin and destination, which could fall under social networks (cs.SOC) and cybersecurity (cs.CYBER). Finally, the paper's focus on the mobility of talent and its implications for the global system of science could also relate to social computing (cs.SI).
